page.title: 04Jackfield Brass Band
page.content: The band started as a pipe and drum band in 1798.It became a brass band in 1893.There is a junior and senior section.The players in the senior section ages range from 12 to 60 plus. It has always been a family band and this tradition continues.One man and his brother and sister all played in the band for over 60 years.The band members are not paid,all the money raised goes towards renewing instruments. The two main competitions the band enters are at Leamington Spa and the area competition which is at Nottingham this year. 28 players take part in the competition. The band plays at local fetes,hospitals and schools.It plays at Jackfield church events. Practises are held on Tuesday and Friday evenings.
